utils package

Submodules

utils.IO module

Utility file

This file implements functionalities used by other modules and accessible to the user

utils.IO.debug_io(message: str, end: str = None, flush: bool = None, unflush: bool = None, flush_block: bool = False)[source]

Prints a debug message if the DEBUG_OPTION is set to a non-zero value.

messagestr

The debug message to log.

endstr, optional

How to end the print, e.g., “

“ (newline). Defaults to None.
flushbool, optional

Whether to forcibly flush the stream. Defaults to None.

unflushbool, optional

If True, adds an additional newline before the message. Defaults to None.

flush_blockbool, optional

If True, prints the whole block at once to avoid disruptions. Defaults to False.

utils.IO.error_io(message: str, exception_type: Exception, end: str = None, flush: bool = None, unflush: bool = None, flush_block: bool = False)[source]

Prints an error message with an error header and raises the specified exception.

messagestr

The error message to log.

exception_typeException

The type of exception to raise after logging the message.

endstr, optional

How to end the print, e.g., “

“ (newline). Defaults to None.
flushbool, optional

Whether to forcibly flush the stream. Defaults to None.

unflushbool, optional

If True, adds an additional newline before the message. Defaults to None.

flush_blockbool, optional

If True, prints the whole block at once to avoid disruptions. Defaults to False.

exception_type

The specified exception type is raised after the error message is logged.

utils.IO.info_io(message: str, level: int = None, end: str = None, flush: bool = None, unflush: bool = None, flush_block: bool = False)[source]

Prints a message with an information header, which can be formatted at different levels, or without any header formatting. Level 0: Wide header Level 1: Medium header Level 2: Narrow header Level None: No header formatting, behaves like the original info_io.

messagestr

The message to log.

levelint, optional

The level of the header, or None for no header formatting. Defaults to None.

endstr, optional

How to end the print, e.g., “

“ (newline). Defaults to None.
flushbool, optional

Whether to forcibly flush the stream. Defaults to None.

unflushbool, optional

If True, adds an additional newline before the message. Defaults to None.

flush_blockbool, optional

If True, prints the whole block at once to avoid disruptions. Defaults to False.

Get a subset of a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • keys (list) – The keys to extract from the dictionary.

Returns:

Returns:
